intro: Picrella trifoliata var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender picrella, is a rare and striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves that are often adorned with fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, it thrives in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
